intro: Viola nubica, commonly known as the alpine violet, is a perennial flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of purple, violet, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Viola nubica thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a popular subject in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
